title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Information Security Analysts

content.rendered:
What is an Information Security Analyst?

Information Security Analysts implement and ensure security for a company’s computer networks. They do this by assessing the network’s vulnerabilities, preventing and responding to viruses, and coming up with strategies to keep the network and the information it contains safe.

Where does an Information Security Analyst work?

  • Computer systems companies
  • Finance companies

How much does an Information Security Analyst make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Information Security Analyst is $71,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Information Security Analysts?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Computer science majors
  • Programming majors
  • Software engineering majors
Search Information Security Analyst jobs

Information Security Analyst skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Information Security Analysts succeed in their work:

  • Strong analytical skills
  • Great prediction skills
  • Detail oriented

What are some common questions about Information Security Analysts?

Q: What’s it like to be an Information Security intern?A: Check out student responses and real intern experiences here.
